intro: Ixeris grandicolla, commonly known as the large-fruited golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its yellow ray florets are surrounded by a ring of tubular disk florets, which are often pollinated by insects. Ixeris grandicolla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
